title: Virginia High School Mountain Bike Series
description: Virginia High School Mountain Bike Series (VAHS  MTB) is Virginia’s official interscholastic mountain bike race series. Sanctioned by USA Cycling, VAHS MTB offers competitive racing for riders of all ability levels. The series is open to ANY high school, middle school, or elementary school student.
course: Races are on primarily single-track trails and are multiple-lap events to provide a spectator-friendly experience for coaches and parents. Open starts allow for safe passing before entering trails, and there are numerous opportunities to pass each lap.
notes:
The Virginia High School Mountain Bike Series is held under USA Cycling Permit and is open to any elementary, middle or high school student in the Commonwealth. Each event has separate Elementary School (ages 9 & over), Middle School, J.V. and Varsity races both girls and boys. Racers do not need to be on a school team to participate nor do racers need to have any race experience.VASH MTB Series is open to public school, independent school, and home school students.
The VAHS MTB Series provides a professional and enjoyable interscholastic racing experience for competitors and spectators. For those new to racing, it is an ideal introduction to mountain bike racing. If you like to mountain bike and are considering racing, this is your chance. Sign up for a race! You will have a blast!

title: Graham Road Elementary PTA Bike Rodeo
Blue Ridge Spring Cycling Power Training Camp
Natural Bridge Cycling Challenge
description: A Gran Fondo-style cycling event in Virginia's beautiful Shenandoah Valley. Routes of 26, 63 and 94 miles are offered.
course: The 26-mile route includes 2047 ft. of climbing and one Category 3 climb. The 63-mile route includes 4773 ft. of climbing and one Category 3 climb. The 94-mile route includes 8,194 ft. of climbing, one Category 1 climb and one Category 3 climb.
notes: Late registration offered onsite Saturday May 2 from 5 to 9 PM at the Natural Bridge Hotel, and Sunday morning from 6:30 to 9 AM, also at the Natural Bridge Hotel. Late fee of $10 applies.
directions: From North: Take Interstate 81 exit 180A - US 11 south and proceed 3 miles to Natural Bridge Parking area on your left. Follow signs for event parking. From South: Take Interstate 81 exit 175 - US 11 north, and proceed 1 mile to Natural Bridge Parking area on your right. Follow signs to event parking.

title: The Chesapeake Criterium and Virgnia Senior State
Jamestown Gran Fondo
description: The Jamestown Gran Fondo is ideally situated in the heart of Virginia’s Historic Triangle. This beautiful ride rapidly takes you on to low traffic, country roads where the pavement is nice and the hills are small. With staggered starts everyone can finish and enjoy BBQ and beer by the water next to the Jamestown Settlement. Don’t miss out on this wonderful time of year to be in Williamsburg, VA.
course: The Jamestown Gran Fondo has Century, Metric Century and 30 mile options. Each distance is fully supported with mechanics and well stocked aid stations. The Century starts at 7:30AM, the Metric Century at 8:30AM, and the 30 miler at 9AM. Each of these rides is mostly flat but has some long, gradual climbs (max 125 ft). The post ride party starts at 11:30AM and goes until 4:00PM. Riders get 2 beers and a BBQ plate with their entry with more available for purchase.
directions: Located adjacent to the Jamestown Settlement in Williamsburg, VA.  See website for details.

title: Advanced Training with Power Camp - Bedford, VA
2015 Air Force Association Cycling Classic-Challenge Ride
Southeastern Gravity Series, Bryce Bike Park
Gran Fondo Alleghany
description:
No need to cross the Atlantic for an Old World cycling experience - come to Virginia's scenic Alleghany Highlands region for the sixth annual Gran Fondo Alleghany Highlands. Easily accessible from Interstate 64, and four hours' drive from both Washington, DC and Charlotte, the Alleghany Highlands' majestic peaks and picturesque valleys might be mistaken for a region of France or Germany. With electronic chip timing, a King of the Mountains competition, and a mass start, all the elements of the classic European Gran Fondo will be here stateside and served up with southern hospitality. No Michelin guide required!

We offer riders three course choices:

Gran Fondo: 105-mile mountainous course. Fee: $75.

Medio Fondo: 68-mile mountainous course. Fee $55.

Piccolo Fondo: 31-mile hilly course. Fee $35.

Fee includes:

Post-ride food and beverage
Bike valet service in Covington Friday night/Saturday morning
Shuttle service from parking at Clifton Forge finish to ride start in Covington on Saturday morning
Free technical/mechanical support
Fully stocked food and water stops
Electronic Chip Timing
Finishers' Medals
course:
This year, the Gran Fondo tackles the climb to Lake Moomaw and across the Gathright Dam first, before heading back through Covington, up Pitzer's Ridge, Warm Springs Mtn., and then Pitzer's Ridge a second time for a total distance of 105 miles and 10,000 ft. of climbing. 

The Medio and Piccolo follow the Gran Fondo route west to Callahan and past Humpback Bridge, but avoid the Lake Moomaw climb and head east to Clifton Forge on the Frontage Road. The Piccolo finishes here, but the Medio Fondo tackles Warm Springs Mtn. before heading back to the finish. The Piccolo is 31 miles with under 2,000 ft. of climbing, and the Medio is 68 miles with almost exactly one mile (5,260 ft.) of vertical gain! 

This year, we'll again be staggering start times, with the Gran Fondo riders starting earliest, in order to have riders finish more closely together to keep a party atmosphere at the finish in Clifton Forge.
directions:
To Registration and Start (Covington)
From I-64, take Exit 14, VA-154, toward Covington/Hot Springs. At
the end of the ramp, make a left onto VA-154 North (S. Craig St.).
After 1.2 miles, make a right onto W. Locust St. Take the second
left onto N. Lexington Av. Then, take the first right onto Main St.
The Covington Farmer’s Market is at the end of the block, just across
from the intersection with Monroe Av. There is on-street parking as
well as a free municipal lot.

title: RGS Title/Prosperity Mortgage Brambleton Town Center Grand Prix
Lil Belgians Cyclocross Camp
description:
Hup, hup! Join Winchester’s fastest bicyclists to learn about the European sport of cyclocross. Instruction
in turning, dismounting, jumping, and some serious fast pedaling will increase children’s coordination and balance, along with providing them the opportunity to experience teamwork. Each child should bring their own bicycle (with or without training wheels), a helmet, water bottle with water.
course: This is a skills clinic and does not have a predetermined course.
registration:
Walk-in: At the Jim Barnett Park offices.

By Phone: Call (540) 662-4946. Must be paid with a credit card and a completed registration form submitted.

By Email: wincparks@winchesterva.gov.

By Fax: (540) 678-8791

Registration form available at: www.winchesterva.gov/parks
notes: Instructor: Mackenzie Vanover. July 13-15 (Monday-Wednesday), 2-3pm, at Jim Barnett Park, Jaycee I Shelter. Fee: $16 R, $19 NR. Register by July 6. Activity# 627117-07.

title: Culpeper Gran Fondo
description: The latest addition to the Mid-Atlantics riding calendar the Culpeper Gran Fondo kicks off our Culpeper Endurance Festival with 30, 62 and 100 mile options.  Join your fellow cyclists on low traffic, country roads that wind through horse country, farmland and vineyards all within sight of the Blue Ridge Mountains.  Each distance is fully supported with mechanics and well stocked aid stations.
course: The Century starts at 7:30AM, the Metric Century and 30 miler both start at  8:30AM.  None of these rides are flat, this is central Virginia, but these rides are gorgeous and fun.  The post ride party starts at 11:00AM and goes until 4:00PM.
registration: Complete information and registration at: https://www.vtsmts.com/culpepergranfondo/
directions: Located in the heart of Virginia just off Rt. 29 between Charlottesville and Washington, DC.  See website for complete directions.

title: 2015 Pre-Event Tour - Alpine Loop Gran Fondo
description:
Created in response to the request of 'Fondo participants, this road cycling event will help ready riders for the Alpine Loop, Shenandoah Mountain Century and Shenandoah Mountain Adventure routes of the 2015 Alpine Loop Gran Fondo.

Jeremiah Bishop will lead the ride with assistance from other Harrisonburg-based professional cyclists. The ride will be fully supported with cycling snacks, a variety of sports drinks and water, fruit, sag vehicles, a picnic lunch and training Q&A following.

This tour is a great opportunity for you to get a glimpse of some steeps climbs and dirt roads of the 2015 Alpine Loop Gran Fondo. It's timed to provide a great training boost in preparation for the Gran Fondo. If you can't participate in the 'Fondo, this ride is a great adventure in and of itself!
course:
Riders who are training for the Alpine Loop should be prepared to ride 85 miles with 7,000+ feet of climbing - one of the mountain climbs is on unpaved steep surfaces. The Route includes the "Dark Side" climb up Shenandoah Mountain from the Alpine Loop Gran Fondo. Exact route will be e-mailed prior to the ride.

Riders who are training for the Shenandoah Mountain Century and Shenandoah Mountain Adventure should be prepared for a 65 mile ride with 6,000-feet of climbing on paved mountain climbs. Route will include the climb up Shenandoah Mountain's Moyers Gap Road from the Alpine Loop Gran Fondo. Exact route will be e-mailed prior to the ride.
registration:
$75 / per person
Includes tour guides, SAG support, ride food, "lunch" break, drinks, and post-ride meal.
notes:
After a warmup through the Valley, the ride will make its way up some great mountain roads. The first climb will treat participants to spectacular scenery. We will divide into two groups which will be based on participants' desired ride length; and ultimate training goals - Alpine Loop or Shenandoah Mountain Century / Shenandoah Mountain Adventure. Throughout the ride, you'll have access to full support from SAG vehicles and enjoy the guidance and expertise of local cycling pro's and seasoned Alpine guides.

At the ride's completion, you'll be treated to lunch, relax, recover and enjoy discussing training tips and preparation for the Gran Fondo with Jeremiah and other professional cyclists.

Riders who arrive in Harrisonburg, Virginia on Saturday, August 23 are invited to join Jeremiah Bishop for an easy spin from Harrisonburg. Details will be e-mailed to participants.

Full details of the training ride including start location, route maps with GPS files will be e-mailed to you in a follow-up message.
directions: Harrisonburg, Virginia. See even registration page for directions.

title: Meadows Farm Pre World's Race One of RIchmond Omnium
Alpine Loop Gran Fondo
description:
Hosted by professional cyclist Jeremiah Bishop, the Alpine Loop Gran Fondo is an event to welcome cyclists and spectators to Harrisonburg, Virginia for an exciting weekend of special events, challenging rides, charity fundraising and festivities for the entire family. 

ENTRY INCLUDES:
107, 103, 78, 62 and 36-MILE ROUTE OPTIONS
HIGH-QUALITY EVENT T-SHIRT (NEW FOR 2015!)
FULLY STOCKED REST STOPS with OSMO HYDRATION STATIONS (DETAILS)
FULLY CATERED MEAL & FINISH LINE FESTIVAL
FIRST BEVERAGE IN BEER GARDEN FOR NO ADDITIONAL COST (NEW FOR 2015!) MUST BE 21+
LIVE MUSIC
ELECTRONIC TIMING START-TO-FINISH, KOM SEGMENTS
5-YEAR AGE GROUP KOM/QOM COMPETITION (107, 100/78-MILE ROUTES)
PROSTATE CANCER AWARENESS PROJECT KOM JERSEYS TO 5-YEAR AGE GROUP WINNERS
FREE HOT SHOWERS AT FINISH LINE
ON-SITE PARKING
PREMIUM FINISHER MEDALLIONS

Specatators and family members can purchase optional Finish Line Festival Meal Ticket to access catering - in advance only. All cycling participants will recieve one complimentary beverage ticket that can be redeemed in the Beer Garden. Additional alcoholic beverages can be purchased onsite with cash. Beer Garden to support the Shenandoah Valley Bicycle Coalition.
course:
107, 103, 78, 62, and 36-mile courses.

Complete details, maps and elevation profiles are available at: http://alpineloopgranfondo.com/routes/
registration:
Register at: https://www.bikereg.com/2015alpineloopgranfondo

Winter pricing available through March 20, 2015
Spring pricing available through May 24, 2015
Regular pricing through July 31, 2015
Late pricing through September 6, 2015
Last minute pricing through September 17, 2015

NO EVENT-DAY REGISTRATION
notes:
No refunds will be issued. No rain date; In the event of EXTREME weather, routes and milage may be adjusted by promoter. Riders can transfer entries to other riders; requests must be made by contacting organizer prior to September 14. 

Information about Host Hotel and Lodging Discounts is available at AlpineLoopGranFondo.com.

BOOK YOUR HARRISONBURG LODGING AS SOON AS POSSIBLE!  

ON SATURDAY, SEPTEMBER 19, THERE WILL BE A JAMES MADISON UNIVERSITY FOOTBALL HOME GAME AT BRIDGEFORTH STADIUM. BECAUSE OF THIS AND THE 'FONDO, HARRISONBURG AREA HOTELS WILL SELL OUT WELL IN ADVANCE OF THE EVENT.
directions: Start/Finish will take place at 228 S Liberty Street, Harrisonburg, VA 22801

title: Gran Fondo Virginia
description:
The Gran Fondo Virginia will explore the rolling hills, lush scenery and vineyards of Albemarle County, Virginia - birthplace and home of U.S. Presidents Thomas Jefferson and James Monroe.

For 2015, we are running the event on Thursday, September 24th in accordance with the schedule for the 2015 UCI World Cycling Championships, held in nearby Richmond. We hope that you will attend this world class event that is coming to the U.S. for only the second time in 100 years, and make the short one-hour drive up to Charlottesville to ride in the Gran Fondo Virginia!

Thursday Spetember 24th is a rest day in the Worlds schedule. Consider coming to Virginia for the final weekend, and stopping off to ride our event. You'll find hotel room availability and lower rates in beautiful and historic Charlottesville as well! 

Route Timing, Neutral Technical Support, Rest Stops featuring local produce and a post-ride party will all contribute to what is sure to become another enduring Virginia tradition!
course: Three course options are available: a 93-mile Gran Fondo, a 70-mile Medio Fondo, and a 33-mile Piccolo Fondo.
registration:
Registration may be completed online at: https://sport-vista.sportngin.com/register/form/776012469
On-site registration will be available from 7-9 AM on event day. $10 late fee applies.
notes:
Entry Fees:

Gran Fondo  $75
Medio Fondo $75
Piccolo Fondo $50
 

Your Entry Fee Includes:

Electronic Chip Timing and Results
Fully stocked feed zones every 20-25 mi.
Mechanical Support on the course
Detailed Route Maps and Course Technical Guide
Post-Event Meal Coupons, redeemable at food trucks on site
Finishers' medals
Equipment and Safety Regulations

The Gran Fondo Virginia is a ride, not a race. However, it will include a mass start, and is subject to some specific regulations under the permit granted by USA Cycling.

All participants must wear a helmet
Bicycles may not have motors or wind fairings attached
No trailers of any kind are allowed
All handlebar ends must be appropriately covered or plugged
Tandems and recumbent bicycles are allowed; however riders of these bicycle types will be separately grouped at the start line
During the registration process, you will be asked to provide your USA Cycling Road Racing Category, if you possess a USAC license. You do not need to possess a USA Cycling license to participate; but we will be lining up riders by experience/ability level.
Cancellation and Refund Policies

The event will run rain, shine, wind or hail. Only extreme weather conditions (flooding) will result in the event being cancelled. Participants will receive full refund of their entry fee in this unlikely scenario.

Otherwise, no refunds. Registration slots may be transferred to another party with the consent of both parties.

Full details on number pick-up, parking and safety regulations will be posted at the event home page.

We look forward to seeing you on the start line at Walnut Creek Park on Thursday, September 24th!
directions:
Directions to Walnut Creek Park:
From Washington D.C, and points north: Take U.S. 29 south to Charlottesville. Take the U.S. 29 Bypass South toward Lynchburg. Proceed 4 miles to I-64. Take I-64 East toward Richmond. After 2 miles, take the 5th St. Exit (Exit 120). Take a right at the end of the ramp onto VA 631/Old Lynchburg Rd. south. Proceed 6.8 miles on Old Lynchburg Rd. to the entrance to Walnut Creek Park on the left. 

From points west: Take I-64 to Charlottesville. Take the second Charlottesville exit, which is the 5th St. Exit (Exit 120). At the end of the ramp, take a right onto VA 631/Old Lynchburg Rd. south. Proceed 6.8 miles on Old Lynchburg Rd. to the entrance to Walnut Creek Park on the left.

From Richmond/points east: Take I-64 to the third Charlottesville exit, which is the 5th St. Exit (Exit 120). At the end of the ramp, take a left onto VA 631/Old Lynchburg Rd. south. Proceed 6.8 miles on Old Lynchburg Rd. to the entrance to Walnut Creek Park on the left.

From Lynchburg/points south: Take U.S, 29 north to the town of North Garden. Make a right turn onto VA 712/Plank Rd. (at the Crossroads Store). Proceed 4.5 miles on Plank Rd. and make a left turn onto VA 631/Old Lynchburg Rd.). Proceed 2.6 miles on Old Lynchburg Rd. to the entrance to Walnut Creek Park on the right.

For GPS routing, use "Walnut Creek Park, North Garden, VA"
